definition: following or accompanying as a consequence, an event or situation that happens at the same time as or in connection with another
details:
adjective
- following or accompanying as a consequence
= example: following or accompanying as a consequence
= synonyms: consequent, accompanying, concomitant, incidental, ensuant, resultant, sequent
- being present (at meeting or event etc.) 'attendant members of the congreation'
noun
- an event or situation that happens at the same time as or in connection with another
= synonyms: accompaniment
- a person who is present and participates in a meeting
= synonyms: attender, attendee, meeter
- someone who waits on or tends to or attends to the needs of another
= synonyms: tender, attender
